item.title: Ignore ‘Sell America’ call, says JPMorgan investment strategy boss—neither tariffs nor national debt are enough to clip the wings of U.S. dominance
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: JPMorgan’s Jacob Manoukian tells Fortune he remains confident in the U.S. economy’s long-term dominance, dismissing “sell America” calls as...

item.title: For the first time in 50 years, the U.S. will likely experience negative net migration, shrinking the U.S. workforce—and economic growth by extension
item.description: Trump’s mass deportation campaign could slash GDP growth by up to 0.4% in 2025 in a “startling” blow to the labor force, economists warn

item.title: Residents at Massachusetts assisted-living facility say staff fled without helping them during fire that killed 9
item.description: Several residents who praised firefighters and police for heroic rescue efforts said staff members did little to help.

item.title: Bitcoin’s rise is fueled by billions in traditional money coming from Wall Street
item.description: The influx of traditional capital is also reducing Bitcoin’s volatility.

item.title: Jensen Huang says AI isn’t likely to cause mass layoffs unless ‘the world runs out of ideas’
item.description: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei has said 50% of entry-level white collar jobs could be eliminated due to AI.
